Beginner Skateboarding

Step 1: Choosing the Right Skateboard

The first step to learning skateboarding is choosing the right skateboard. Make sure to select a board that suits your size and riding style. Here's a GIF to help you understand the different parts of a skateboard:

image 1

Step 2: Getting Comfortable with Stance

Before you start riding, it's essential to get comfortable with your stance. Most skateboarders either ride regular (left foot forward) or goofy (right foot forward). Try both to see which feels more natural for you. Here's a GIF demonstrating regular and goofy stances:

Step 3: Learning to Push

Pushing is the fundamental skill in skateboarding. Practice pushing off the ground with your back foot while keeping your front foot on the skateboard. Here's a GIF showing how to push properly:

{/* Add more steps as needed */}
); }; export default Beginner;
